div.p: From John Duff to Charles Gavan Duffy
B72/1126, unit 618, VPRS 3991 inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Trans. Angela. To proof.
Botanic Gardens

Having been informed that your Government contemplate making alterations in the management of the Melbourne Botanic Gardens, and that there is a probability of one or more officers being required, I have the honor to offer myself as a candidate.

The writer has held the office of Superintendant in these Gardens for the past five and a half years, having been selected in England under competition and examination, by Messrs Veitch & Sons of the Royal Exotic Nursery, Chelsea, London.
Previous to this engagement I was employed in the Glasgow Royal Botanic Garden for a period of four years, and have also had six years experience in private Gentlemens Gardens, and Nurseries.

During the absence of the Director of these Gardens as Commissioner for this Colony to the Paris Exhibition, I performed his duties for fifteen months, and it being well known that the reputation of this department has been creditably sustained since my arrival, is, I presume a sufficient guarantee of my ability to fulfil the requisite duties in your Garden.
Soliciting your favorable consideration, and awaiting reply.
